ABOUT THRIVE MARKET 

Thrive Market was founded in 2014 with a mission to make healthy living easy and affordable for everyone. As an online, membership-based market, we deliver the highest quality healthy and sustainable products at member-only prices, while matching every paid membership with a free one for someone in need. Every day, we leverage innovative technology and member-first thinking to help our over 1,000,000 members find better products, support better brands, and build a better world in the process. We recently reached a significant milestone by becoming a Certified B Corporation, making us the largest grocer to earn this coveted qualification.

Our Platform team is growing, this time, we are seeking to add a high-impact Data Science, Manager to our Data Science team. This role responsible for leading a team of data scientists and overseeing data-driven projects within Thrive Market. Youll have the opportunity to build data science the way you think its intended for our subscribers needs. 

At Thrive, weve created a transparent, data-centric environment from the beginning and well need your help applying algorithms, machine learning, AI, and other tools across our business; working cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, merchandising, and operations. All in efforts of unlocking our full potential!
RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to a team of data scientists, including task assignment, project management, and performance evaluation
Develop and implement advanced analytical models, algorithms, and statistical methods to extract insights and solve complex business problems. This includes data preprocessing, feature engineering, predictive modeling, machine learning, and deep learning techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as business executives, product managers, and engineers, to understand business goals and define data-driven strategies. Identify opportunities where data science can drive business value and provide recommendations to improve products, processes, and customer experiences
Explore and analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights 
Present findings to stakeholders using data visualization tools and techniques, making complex concepts understandable to non-technical audiences
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence technologies
Provide guidance and expertise in selecting appropriate tools, frameworks, and programming languages to support data science projects
Foster a collaborative work environment, promoting effective communication and knowledge sharing within the team and across departments
Effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, enabling them to make informed decisions based on data insights
Define project objectives, deliverables, and timelines; Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality results
Manage resource allocation and prioritize tasks to meet business objectives
Encourage a culture of learning and innovation within the team
Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, and drive the adoption of best practices to enhance the teams capabilities and overall performance
Document methodologies, assumptions, and results of data science projects
Prepare clear and concise reports and presentations summarizing findings, insights, and recommendations for various stakeholders, including senior management
Convey concise and actionable stories through data to different stakeholders of the company
Apply advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from large and complex datasets to drive business decisions and strategies

QUALIFICATIONS 

M.S. or Ph.D degree in statistics, computer science, operations research, computational physics, engineering, or related field
At least 6 years of data science experience in eCommerce, SaaS, or other digital based businesses
Strong understanding of online advertising, AB testing, cohort analysis, conversion optimization, customer segmentation, etc.
Experience with supervised and unsupervised data mining algorithms like deep learning, support vector machines, boosting, LDA, and logistic regression, etc
Proficiency in at least one high level programming language like Python  Java  C.Experience with large scale data analysis in Spark, Pandas or Hive is a plus 
Experience using data visualization frameworks such as Matplotlib, DomoTableau or related programs is a plus
Good critical thinking and problem solving skills
Effective interpersonal and communication skills - we work cohesively and want to bring in folks who seek to drive unity 
Ability to independently lead and execute projects 
Curious, hungry, proactive, results-oriented, data-driven, and thrives in fast-paced, team-oriented environments 

BELONG TO A BETTER COMPANY

Comprehensive health benefits medical, dental, vision, life and disability
Competitive salary DOE  equity
401k plan
Flexible Paid Time Off
Subsidized ClassPass Membership with access to fitness classes and wellness and beauty experiences
Stocked kitchen in our Thrive Market Home Office with Thrive Market products
Dog-Friendly Office
Yoga, meditation and other weekly events for mindfulness
Coverage for Life Coaching  Therapy Sessions on our holistic mental health and well-being platform
Free Thrive Market membership and discount on private label products
Casual atmosphere and great people to work with

Our Mission 
6sense is on a mission to revolutionize how B2B organizations create revenue by predicting customers most likely to buy and recommending the best course of action to engage anonymous buying teams. 6sense Revenue AI is the only sales and marketing platform to unlock the ability to create, manage and convert high-quality pipeline to revenue. 
Our People 
People are the heart and soul of 6sense. We serve with passion and purpose. We live by our Being 6sense values of Accountability, Growth Mindset, Integrity, Fun and One Team. Every 6sensor plays a part in dening the future of our industry-leading technology.  6sense is a place where difference-makers roll up their sleeves, take risks, act with integrity, and measure success by the value we create for our customers. 
We want 6sense to be the best chapter of your career. 

Senior Manager, Data Science 
6Sense is revolutionizing the sales and marketing processes for B2B companies with its Predictive Intelligence Engine. By leveraging advanced machine learning, predictive modeling, and big data analysis, 6Sense helps businesses identify potential buyers, predict their purchasing behavior, and optimize their sales and marketing strategies.  
The platform is designed to enhance B2B marketing and sales organizations understanding of the complex ABM Account-Based Marketing buyer journey. By combining intent signals from various channels with cutting-edge AI predictive capabilities, 6Sense enables the prediction of account demand and the optimization of demand generation in the ABM realm. Equipped with the powerful 6Sense Demand PlatformTM and AI technology, marketing and sales professionals can effectively identify, prioritize, and engage buyers, ultimately driving increased revenue.   
At 6Sense, our data scientists play a pivotal role in both engineering and shaping the product itself. They are not simply optimizing software but rather building models, working with extensive datasets, and leveraging essential APIs that drive the 6Sense product. As the Data Science Manager, you will have the opportunity to work with large-scale data sets, utilize state-of-the-art technology, and witness your insights transformed into tangible products on a regular basis. We are seeking an individual with experience in leading and growing teams of data scientists. Your role will involve providing strategic guidance and overall direction, mentoring team members to achieve outstanding results and sustained engagement.  
As the Sr. Manager of Data Science at 6Sense, you will have the following key responsibilities  


Lead the successful implementation of company-wide initiatives in alignment with 6Senses Data Science strategy, working closely with the VP of Data Science.  


Build and nurture a high-performing team of data science professionals, ensuring collaboration, excellence, and success in demanding environments.  


Collaborate with data scientists and managers to develop and publish Data Sciences annual and quarterly roadmap.  


Drive the development and launch of exceptional data science tools and products. Manage all aspects of product development, including timelines, scope, technical requirements, and resource allocation, in collaboration with Data Science, Engineering, and Product leadership. Ensure the on-time delivery of high-quality final products.  


Drive project definition by capturing high-level requirements and long-term goals from business and technical stakeholders. Translate these into detailed roadmaps and actionable tasks for data scientists. 


Lead effective communication and action plans related to technical risks, mitigation strategies, expectations, priorities, and schedules for projects and roadmaps. Foster strong and collaborative relationships across cross-functional teams, serving as the key interface to key functions.  


Proactively champion process improvements, accountability, and productivity enhancements across multiple teams and functions. Establish and influence standard, repeatable, and transparent processes. 


Required Qualifications  


7 years of experience in delivering data science solutions, with at least 3 years of experience managing teams of 5 data scientists.  


Demonstrated experience in implementing scalable data science solutions and products, preferably in predictive modeling and NLP Natural Language Processing.  


Proven track record of driving programs, including the creation of functional specifications, release plans, and roadmaps.  


Excellent communication, leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence peers and managers, resolve conflicts, and build consensus in ambiguous situations.  


Self-motivation, critical thinking, and adaptability. You possess the ability to balance business needs, urgency, and the delivery of high-quality, practical solutions.  


Bachelors degree in a quantitative field or relevant industry experience. A masters degree or PhD is preferred. 


Base Salary Range 173,325 to 265,765. The base salary range represents the anticipated low and high end of the base salary range for this position. Actual salaries may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including but not limited to work location and experience. The base salary is one component of 6senses total compensation package for this position. Other compensation may include a bonus program or commission plan, and stock options if approved by 6senses board. In addition, 6sense provides a variety of benefits, including generous health insurance coverage, life, and disability insurance, a 401K employer matching program, paid holidays, self-care days, and paid time off PTO. Li-remote

We are looking for a Manager Data Science to lead one of our Data Science and Machine Learning teams. This team solves real-world data science challenges for stakeholders across the organisation, including Product Engineering, UX, Sales and Customer Care. You will provide leadership and guidance to all members in your team, focus on the teams productivity and strive to increase the impact of your teams work every day. 
At AutoScout24, we appreciate different lifestyles and cultural backgrounds.  We welcome diversity as a strength. Our organization is, e.g. made up of more than 50 different nationalities, all working together inclusively and respectfully. 
 
What youll do  


Empower your team and create a safe and inclusive environment, help people grow  


Identify and tackle existing problems, have difficult conversations and decisions to move your team and the company forward  


Give your team direction and guidance according to the company strategy and priorities  


Work closely with Product Managers, Lead Engineers and Data Scientists and your peers across the Tech function to build solutions that make a difference for the business 


Define an executable data science roadmap your team can deliver on, that supports the product roadmaps of our Builders organisation   


Provide methodical and technical guidance to the team and establish best practices that lead to reliable data-science based products and a productive team 


Team-up with your recruitment colleagues to attract the best talent that fit to your team and our company  


Manage the delivery of the team and be accountable for the teams outcomes  


 
What you should bring  


Experience working as an engineering manager, data science manager or on a similar leadership position  


A passion for building, leading and nurturing successful data science and engineering teams  


A clear and fluid communication style  


Excitement about working with the latest machine learning approaches, like Transformers, Embeddings and Learning to rank 


Experience running machine learning workloads in production. We use, e.g. Python, FastAPI and PyTorchTensorflow running on AWS. 


If this appeals to you but you are in doubt about how exactly your skills match our requirements - we value personality, ambition and an open mind. Dont hesitate to get in touch and present your personal strengths to us.

Thumbtack has multiple Software Engineer, Data Science positions available in San Francisco, CA, and various unanticipated work locations throughout the USA.
Responsibilities

Design innovative AB testing techniques to gather, organize, test, and interpret data across millions of interconnected customers.
Work with predictive modeling problems across our product to model complex data relationships in the presence of many confounding factors, using in-depth knowledge of probability and statistics, experimental design, predictive modeling, optimization, and causal interference.
Scope, design and implement machine learning models to support Thumbtacks products, utilizing knowledge of machine learning regression and classification, clustering, feature selection, curse of dimensionality, bias-variance tradeoff, neural networks, and SVMs.
Design and execute experiments dealing with big data, including collecting and analyzing test data to guide launch decisions.
Architect and deploy machine learning systems to production.
Design and implement metrics that align with company goals.
Analyze a wide variety of data structured and unstructured, observational, and experimental, with the goal of influencing system designs and implementations.
Advise engineering and product teams on sound statistical practice including statistical computing language such as R or PythonPandas.
Telecommuting permitted.

What youll need

Masters degree in Computer Science, or a related field.
Three 3 years of experience in the job offered or in a data science-related occupation.
Minimum one 1 year of experience required in each of the following skills

Machine learning
Regression and classification
Data visualization using Python, R, or Mode
Exploratory analysis using SQL, Python, R, or Matlab
Programming languages including Python, Java, Go, or C
pyspark
Amazon Sagemaker

Company at a Glance
OpenX is focused on unleashing the full economic potential of digital media companies. We do this by making digital advertising markets and technologies that are designed to deliver optimal value to publishers and advertisers on every ad served across all screens.

At OpenX, we have built a team that is uniquely experienced in designing and operating high-scale ad marketplaces, and we are constantly on the lookout for thoughtful, creative executors who are as fascinated as we are about finding new ways to apply a blend of market design, technical innovation, operational excellence, and empathetic partner service to the frontiers of digital advertising.

OpenX is looking for talented and highly motivated software engineers to help us innovate and improve our products. You will work closely with the OpenX Data Science team to find areas where machine learning and other techniques can be applied to directly improve profitability and efficiency. You will work with huge data sets, design experiments, and write the code to implement optimizations based on the results.
Key Responsibilities

Develop high-performance, low-latency backend components.
Work with analysts and scientists to design, implement, and analyze experiments aimed at increasing yield for publishers and improving efficiency for our advertising partners.
Architect, implement and deliver new features and functionality.
Work with Engineering and Product teams distributed across multiple locations to drive requirements, and own the projects end-to-end.

Requirements

2-3 years of engineering experience with backend languages like Java, Golang, or Erlang
Excellent communication in written and spoken English
Experience writing SQL queries
Experience with GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and Cloudbuild
B.S.M.S. in Computer Science or an equivalent discipline


OpenX VALUES
Our five company values form a solid bedrock serving to define us as a group and guide the company. Our values remind us that how we do things often matters as much as what we do.

WE ARE ONE
We are one team. There are no exceptions. We are a group of strong and diverse individuals unified by a shared mission. We embrace challenges and win together as a team. We respect and care about our colleagues and cultivate an inclusive culture

WE ARE CUSTOMER CENTRIC
We innovate on behalf of our customers. We understand, respect, and listen carefully to our customers. We build great products to solve our customers problems. OPENX IS OURS
We innovate on behalf of our customers. We understand, respect, and listen carefully to our customers. We build great products to solve our customers problems. We manage our customers expectations clearly and honestly. We are a trusted partner to all of our customers - we act with integrity at all times. We care.

WE ARE AN OPEN BOOK

WE EVOLVE FAST
We take responsible risks and own and learn from our mistakes. We recognize and repeat success. We actively seek out and provide constructive feedback. We adapt quickly and embrace change. We tackle growth and learning with real urgency. We are endlessly curious.

Job Description
Key Skills
Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills, Statistical Modelling, Data Analysis, Risk Scorecard Development, Machine Learning etc.,

Overview 
Dun  Bradstreet Technology and Corporate Services India LLP is looking for candidates for the role of Senior Analyst to support the Data Science team. Job Title: Senior Manager, Data Science Ads Products
Job Description:
About Pinterest  
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. Its where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, youll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. Youll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term thats uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. 

Were looking for a Senior Data Science Manager that will help in changing the way ads have been delivered over the last 20 years, breaking models, assumptions and thinking innovatively about protecting Pinner experience while generating revenue. The team is responsible for supporting all the surfaces in the Pinterest app - Home Feed, Search, Related Pins, Shopping Surfaces, Idea Streams etc. Each of them brings its own complexity and challenges which will provide exposure to a wide variety of data science problems to solve. This person would work with world class data science and ML talent in building the next generation advertising products and become a leader of leaders, developing a best in-class team of technical data scientists.
What youll do


Build, inspire and grow a high performance team of data scientists and managers that are thought partners to M10N Ads Products.


Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of key business metrics and the ability to leverage data insights to drive growth and achieve tangible business outcomes.


Work with product and eng partners help identify and answer important why questions. Lead the team to structure ambiguous business challenges into actionable plans. Ensure that your team is producing consistently trustworthy and high-quality technical outputs that influence the business. Drive data-driven decision-making aligned with the organizations strategic objectives.


Communicate complex analytical findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.


Be a champion for building highly talented and diverse teams with an inclusive culture.


What were looking for


MS or PhD in a quantitative field or equivalent experience.


Experience in managing teams of data scientists, data engineers, and analytics engineer, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.


Hands on experience as a data scientist, algorithmic engineer, or machine learning engineer in a technology company.


Demonstrated skills in selecting the right statistical tools given a data analysis problem. 


Effective written and verbal communication skills.


Experience with hypothesis driven product development. 


Experience being a thought partner to improve decision quality and able to influence with expertise.


 
This position is not eligible for relocation assistance.
LI-NM4


At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.
Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

US based applicants only

187,000327,000 USD



Our Commitment to Diversity
Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify accessibilitypinterest.com for support.

Our Company

SAVii was founded in 2017 as SAVii PH, since then, we have been revolutionizing the employee wellness landscape. Our primary goal is to transform lives everyday by offering 360 salary linked wellness services in emerging markets. We currently operate in the Philippines and India.

Through our employee benefits platform, we empower HR leaders with 360 degree salary linked financial wellness services that elevate team members personally and professionally. Fast forward to today, we are now the category leader in our pioneer market of the Philippines. We are always here to transform lives with you. Together, lets make financial power at work a reality.

Our Culture

SAVii is all about people. We aim to transform lives everyday for our customers and our own team members. We promote a culture of people-centricity, engage deeply with our SAViiers and encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work. Each member of our team has something unique to contribute, so we naturally embrace your individuality and recognize your unique perspective as an important catalyst of positive change. We are a remote-first organization, we work where we feel happy and productive. Beyond the monetary aspect, we offer a plethora of enabling benefits enhancing your personal and professional life. In SAVii, we Think Fast, and execute faster.

Our Values

Excellence is an Attitude. We are Licensed to Dare so that everyone can Learn and Succeed. Our shared culture of respect and Fast Executions are built on Integrity and knowing we are Stronger Together.

What youll do

As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate building and implementing predictive models and automate decision-making. Overall, this role is responsible for designing machine learning systems, which involves assessing and organizing data, executing tests and experiments, and generally monitoring and optimizing machine learning processes to help develop strong performing machine learning systems. You will work on varied subjects across the organization across different data models and stakeholders.
Duties and Responsibilities

Designing, developing, and researching Machine Learning systems, models, and schemes
Training and retraining ML systems and models as needed. Verifying data quality andor ensuring it via data cleaning for training data
Deploying models in the production environment
Performing statistical analysis and using results to improve models
Identifying differences in data distribution that could affect model performance in real-world situations
Monitoring model performance vs basic statistical methods for cost-benefit analysis as well as deployment performance and adherence to specifications
Produce and maintain all documentation related to data models or analysis

Other Duties and Responsibilities
In addition, the Data Scientist may be tasked to lead other special projects from the VP of Data or Chief Risk Officer.
Must-have qualifications

Minimum of 3 years experience as a Data Scientist or related field ML Engineer, Statistician
Deep analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in data mining, statistical methods, machine-learning or operations research
Extensive experience in SQL, Python and its related libraries Pandas, Scikit-learn.
Experience in building Data Science pipeline from data collection to model training  deployment
Experience in deploying machine learning models, decision trees, survival analysis, time series analysis, neural network.
Excellent communication and presentation skills

Nice-to-have qualifications

Background in Mathematics, probability, statistics; Masters degree in Data Science
Knowledge of TensorFlow, Spark and Hadoop

Role Sr. Manager, Data Science
Location Palo Alto, CA  Oakland, CA  Austin, TX  Bedminster, NJ  US - Remote
Reports to VP, Actuarial Pricing  Analytics 
About Hippo 
Our mission is to deliver intuitive and proactive protection for homeowners, combining the power of technology with a human touch.
Hippo built the worlds first home protection platform. We believe that insurance should protect your home and the things you treasure with policies designed for modern lives and proactive protection that helps you care for your home. Our aim is to help you avoid issues before they become costly problems because the best claims experience is the one you dont have. Simply put, Hippo exists to protect the joy of homeownership.
About You
As a Senior Manager, Data Science, you will lead our data science team and drive the development and implementation of advanced analytics models and solutions. You will support cross-functional teams to leverage data-driven insights and enhance decision-making processes across various functions within the organization, with a focus on delivering and maintaining a suite of production models and tools to automate real-time decisions in a connected and scalable way.
What Youll Do
Leadership and Strategy

Provide strategic direction and guidance for the data science team, aligning it with the companys goals and objectives supporting multiple functional areas including Pricing, Underwriting, Actuarial, Risk, Agency, Marketing, Smart Home, and Home Care teams
Solve complex business problems, with a strong emphasis on data quality, accuracy, and model governance
Advise and collaborate on long term data strategy and vision, including the expansion of first-party data and third-party data opportunities, to build a comprehensive picture of every home
Lead and mentor a globally dispersed team of data scientists, providing guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities
Foster a collaborative team culture, promoting knowledge sharing, continuous learning, and a strong commitment to data quality and business value

Advanced Analytics, Modeling, and Model Governance 

Apply advanced statistical and machine learning to analyze large and complex datasets, extracting actionable insights while maintaining a focus on data quality
Support the entire organization by developing and deploying systems of predictive models that optimize decision making along the entire customer journey
Own the model governance process to ensure stakeholder buy-in and consistency from early design to post-deployment 
Work with engineers to deploy scalable machine learning and linear models in production environments, establishing best practices for model governance, performance and drift monitoring, and model validation

Data Pipeline Development

Collaborate with stakeholders and engineers to define data requirements and design new features for predictive models
For all features, implement via scalable data pipelines that ensure the re-usability of high-quality data
Work closely with product and engineers to establish efficient data collection, storage, and production transformations that support the organizations current and future data needs

Research and Innovation

Conduct research and analysis to identify new data sources and assess their quality, reliability, and suitability for integration into our data pipelines
Lead the development of future risk and customer-level models, leveraging emerging data sources and cutting-edge methodologies

Must Haves

7 years of experience leading data science initiatives and managing a team of data scientists
B.S. in a related field of study
Proactive mindset with a passion for exploring new technologies, methodologies, and innovative data sources
Strong expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning
Experience deploying models in a market-facing organization with accountability for business impact 
Strong hands-on programming skills, with expertise preferred in Python and SQL Big Query

Nice To Haves

Practice with MLOps and experience deploying machine learning models in production environments, including model governance and performance monitoring
Experience with computer vision and natural language processing is a plus
Familiarity with the homeowners insurance industry and related risk modeling is a plus

Benefits and PerksHippo treats its team members with the same level of dedication and care as we do our customers, which is why were fortunate to provide all of our Hippos with


Healthy Hippos Benefits - 100 Employer paid medical, dental  vision plan options for our team members AND their families yes, you read that correctly. As well as 401k, long  short-term disability, employer-paid life insurance, flexible spending accounts for health and dependent care, and an Employee Assistance Program EAP.

Training and Career Growth - Paid training opportunities and countless internal career growth opportunities

Award-Winning Culture - Recognized by BuiltIn and Inc. Magazine as a top place to work - we value integrity, inclusiveness, empathy, and being proactive and dedicated

Flexible Time Off - You know when and how you should recharge

Little Hippos Program - We offer 12 weeks of parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers.

The base pay range for this role is 169,600 - 254,400. The SF Bay Area base pay range for this role is 186,000 - 278,900. Exact compensation may vary based on several job-related factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, educationtraining, location, business needs and market demands.
Hippo is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. 
Hippos applicants are considered solely based on their qualifications, without regard to an applicants disability or need for accommodation. Any Hippo applicant who requires reasonable accommodations during the application process should contact the Hippos People Team to make the need for an accommodation known.

About SecurityScorecard
SecurityScorecard is the global leader in cybersecurity ratings, with over 12 million companies continuously rated, operating in 64 countries. Founded in 2013 by security and risk experts Dr. Alex Yampolskiy and Sam Kassoumeh and funded by world-class investors, SecurityScorecards patented rating technology is used by over 25,000 organizations for self-monitoring, third-party risk management, board reporting, and cyber insurance underwriting; making all organizations more resilient by allowing them to easily find and fix cybersecurity risks across their digital footprint. 
Headquartered in New York City, our culture has been recognized by Inc Magazine as a "Best Workplace, by Crains NY as a "Best Places to Work in NYC," and as one of the 10 hottest SaaS startups in New York for two years in a row. Most recently, SecurityScorecard was named to Fast Companys annual list of the Worlds Most Innovative Companies for 2023 and to the Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces in 2023 award recognizing forward-thinking employers for their unwavering commitment to employee engagement.  SecurityScorecard is proud to be funded by world-class investors including Silver Lake Waterman, Moodys, Sequoia Capital, GV and Riverwood Capital.
About the Role
The Head of Data Science is a leadership role responsible for developing and the ongoing operation of the companys tools, technologies, and technical solutions leveraging data science, advanced analytics, machine learning, generative AI, and other algorithms. In addition, the VP of Data Science is responsible for the ongoing strategic advancement of the companys data science capabilities.
As the VP of Data Science, you will be responsible for defining the roadmap for your team and partnering with Product and Engineering to materialize those initiatives.
Responsibilities 

Partner with senior business, product, and engineering leaders to develop strategic goals and direction needed to continuously enhance the companys technology platforms
Be a technical leader for the data science team, helping institute best engineering practices coding standards, automated testing, scalability and grow the technical capabilities of the team
Ensure data best practices and play a critical role in building a data-driven culture throughout the entire organization
Partner with senior business, product, and engineering leaders to develop strategic goals
Partner with the technology leadership team to create a long-term vision and develop a roadmap of data science projects
Conceive, develop, implement, and continually improve machine learning projects
Leverage skills, experience, and creativity to apply data science to tackle interesting and challenging problems
Develop new capabilities to deliver business solutions by applying data science algorithms
Build and lead a high-performing team of data scientists, helping to enhance their skills while creating a fun and engaging culture that helps them prosper
Foster career growth and provide thoughtful mentorship to develop employees at varying levels of experience. Establish a clear vision and mission for the data science department
Work with cross-functional partners and executives in product, engineering, operations, finance, and marketing to define and achieve business goals and to build data-informed business strategies and roadmaps
Determine leveraging data science, machine learning, and other analytical techniques to improve product features and capabilities. Provide leadership on how to leverage data and data expertise to improve the customer experience
Develop analytical frameworks, models, roadmaps, and metrics for the team and broader organization
Serve as a champion for data science and informed decision-making at all levels of the company. Make analytical techniques approachable and understandable to non-data scientists
Lead the end-to-end planning and execution of all data analytics and sciences initiatives

Qualifications

10 years of advanced analytics or data science experience
Masters degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or any other related quantitative field
5 years of management experience in leading data science teams with a successful track record in building teams, defining goals and overseeing execution
Proven track record of solving ambiguous and complex data problems at scale, strong quantitative modeling skills inclusive of machine learning
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. You are equally comfortable presenting to executives and peers as you are writing complex SQL queries
Business Acumen  Proven ability to apply data science capabilities to solve practical business problems
Product Sense - Understanding of a product planning process, ability to influence product strategies and roadmaps, strong collaboration skills
Expert level knowledge in predictive analytics, machine learning, and data mining
Proficiency in Python, Spark, Notebooks, AWS, Generative AI models, etc.
Data  ML Architecture  Experienced integrating data science applications into software products. Understands ML Ops deploymentscalable infrastructure
Has worked with data at scale and velocity
MentorCoach  A player-coach who can roll up sleeves, solve problems as a team, and facilitate the teams success
Proven ability to attract, hire, develop, and retain exceptional talent
A dynamic, forward-thinking leader who will bring intensity and commitment to the business. A bias toward action, experimentation, and velocity


BenefitsWe offer a competitive salary, stock options, Health benefits, and unlimited PTO, parental leave, tuition reimbursements, and much more!
If you are a resident of Colorado, New York City, California, or Washington State, please email us at talentacquisitionoperationssecurityscorecard.io to receive compensation information for this role.

At Klaviyo, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo we call ourselves Klaviyos brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. If youre a close but not exact match with the description, we hope youll still consider applying. Want to learn more about life at Klaviyo? Visit careers.klaviyo.com to see how we empower creators to own their own destiny.
About the team
Klaviyo operates a real-time data analytics platform coded primarily in Python that is built for massive scale and hosted on Amazon Web Services AWS. Engineers come to Klaviyo with experience in a variety of languages and from a number of disciplines.
At Klaviyo, we love tackling tough engineering problems and look for employees who specialize in certain areas but are passionate about building, owning  scaling features end to end from scratch and breaking through any obstacle or technical challenge in their way. We push each other to move out of our comfort zone, learn new technologies, and work hard to ensure each day is better than the last. Learn more about our engineering culture at httpsklaviyo.tech
 
About the role
The Engineering Manager of the Data Science DS Platform team is responsible for leading the team of Machine Learning Engineers who build and maintain the services that enable and accelerate Data Science and Machine Learning at Klaviyo, including tooling for training, testing, serving, and monitoring models. Klaviyo continues to invest heavily in machine learning and data science, and you have the opportunity to lay the foundation for work we do in these areas.
Engineering Managers at Klaviyo are hands-on, meaning they spend some significant part of their time writing and reviewing code and specs, as well as working with counterparts such as data scientists using the frameworks developed by the Platform team and engineering teams who rely on the deployed models to power customer facing features. Your tech stack includes Python, AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform. 

How youll have an impact
30 days 

You will have finished onboarding including engineering and data science specific onboarding, and your local developer environment is set up and usable.
You will have met with all of the team members and have already contributed a first PR.

60 days 

You will have successfully contributed multiple PRs to projects in flight.
You regularly have 11s with team members currently 3 engineers.
You will have met with stakeholders such as Data Science Managers, Product Managers, Legal  Security, and Data Infrastructure engineers in order to gather the necessary context for future projects and understand requirements or constraints on system design imposed by those dependencies.

90 days

You will have solidly taken over team processes and be actively planning team work both current and upcoming, and youve started to formulate a vision for priorities for the upcoming quarter of work.
You will be well versed in existing systems, including what areas have gaps that need to be filled, and have started working with the team and stakeholders to scope and prioritize solutions.

Up to 1 year 

You will have successfully led the team to deliver multiple high impact projects that significantly improve the functionality and scalability of systems owned by DS Platform.
You will have developed short, medium, and long-term roadmaps in partnership with stakeholders that give confidence that the DS Platform services will be able to scale at the same pace as Klaviyos DS and ML business needs.
You will have hired or are in the process of hiring additional engineers to grow the team.
You will have formulated career development goals and plans for your team members and are mentoring them on how to succeed.


What were looking for

2 years people management experience
5 years technical expertise in MLOps or adjacent areas
Experience putting machine learning models with a variety of applications and usage patterns into production
Proficient with Python, AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes
Excited to read the code, understand the product area, and give applicable technical mentorship.
Comfortable giving performance review, coaching team members on their technical growth, and mentoring team members at various levels

 
Nice to have

Experience with Jenkins, Ray, Spark, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Huggingface, GPU, Deep Learning

Were Klaviyo pronounced clay-vee-oh. We empower creators to own their destiny by making first-party data accessible and actionable like never before. We see limitless potential for the technology were developing to nurture personalized experiences in ecommerce and beyond. To reach our goals, we need our own crew of remarkable creatorsambitious and collaborative teammates who stay focused on our north star delighting our customers. Job Title: VP of Data Science and Analytics
Job Description:
Blind is an anonymous community of over 8M verified, working professionals where people can talk honestly about work. These genuine and transparent conversations are what sets us apart from other services like LinkedIn. Our mobile app is used by tech workers on a daily basis to connect with peers across the industry or their coworkers. Its often considered a lifeline for those seeking information and advice - especially lately with all the news about layoffs - and we believe we can build the largest community for professionals to help each other with some of their toughest personal and professional challenges.
The Data Analytics team at Blind focuses on delivering key insights to both business and product teams all across the company. We work with various tools and data sources to tell stories and make recommendations. Our partners rely on us to provide the insights  product knowledge to help them make the right decisions to keep our company  community growing!
 
We are looking for a seasoned data leader to help us better understand the complex community, user behaviors, and monetization opportunities for Blind. This person will help lead our personalization efforts for the community and job matching capabilities for our jobs marketplace products. There is close partnership with the engineering team to continue investing in our data infrastructure, AB testing capabilities, and advancing our reporting  self-service tools. This position reports to the COO.
 
This is a remote position with a Pacific time zone work schedule.

Responsibilities

Be a part of the leadership team and help guide strategic planning
Manage a global team of 10 data analysts and ML data scientists, including managers
Drive the evolution of multiple products powered by data science and ML
Work closely with various engineering teams to advance our data platform e.g. Redshift, Sagemaker, Airflow
Create systems and processes for metrics reporting and understanding e.g. Tableau, Superset, etc
Maintain a high bar in terms of analytical rigor and teeing up key business decisions



Basic qualifications

10 years of experience with large scale consumer products with millions of users and experience evolving products powered by data science or machine learning
Bachelors degree in relevant discipline Data Science, Computer Science, etc. or equivalent experience
5 years of experience building, managing, and growing a data science team 
Experience building out data infrastructure and AB testing platforms
Proficiency with both B2C and B2B products, key metrics, and growth levers
Ability to communicate complex concepts in a simple way and influence all audiences
Demonstrated ability to function in a fast-paced, innovative company

Blinds minimum cash compensation salary range for this role is 200,000.00 to 260,000.00 USD per year. This salary range includes compensation for multiple job levels. Your job level will be based on an assessment of your interview performance and experience, which you can always ask about to understand in more detail. Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on geography, candidate experience and expertise, and other factors. Salary is just one component of our total rewards package for employees at Blind. Total rewards include equity, medical, dental, and vision coverage, a flexible PTO policy, parental leave, stipends for WFH and LD, and other region-specific benefits.

Blind is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to bringing transparency to the workplace, and we actively work to hire and retain the best-qualified people regardless of race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status by federal, state, or local laws. Individuals with disabilities or special needs can request accommodation by contacting us at recruitingteamblind.com

Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alonecome make with us!
Were looking for a senior leader to join our data science org who is excited about the challenges that come with rapid growth, and passionate about connecting people together through a positive and inclusive culture. As the Data Science Manager for Figmas business data functions, youll work closely with your team, executives, and the broader data organization to deliver strategic insights and build data products to drive operational efficiency and help Figma meet its business objectives.
 
This is a full time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.
 
What youll do at Figma


Manage, support, and grow a diverse team of data scientists, business analysts, and managers who own all aspects of data within the finance, marketing, and sales organizations


Partner with finance, marketing, and sales leadership to set goals, strategies, and priorities

Foster a data-driven culture by elevating metrics reporting and understanding of business trends
Guide development of new and more sophisticated applications of data
Establish trust within and across teams by creating accountability and a positive work environment in partnership with other leaders in the organization
Grow your career in an engaged and creative community

Wed love to hear from you if you have


5 years of experience managing high-output data science teams of various sizes 

Intimate experience working with Finance, Sales, and Marketing organizations

Strong financial modeling experience and a willingness to dig into the details 


Proven track record of influencing business objectives and shipping high-quality data products that support business objectives

Firm knowledge of statistical methods, including forecasting, lead scoring, and attribution modeling

A passion and unwavering commitment to leveraging data and metrics to guide business decisions

A desire to build an inclusive and diverse culture

Experience scaling teams in high-growth environments


A highly entrepreneurial roll up your sleeves mindset


At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If youre excited about this role but your past experience doesnt align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Description
The Service Design Excellence team build solutions that involve learning from large amounts of data to deliver business impact. We are looking for a Director Data Science to improve theprofitability and business processes; the position is responsible for supervising and directing data processing, scientific modeling, and materialization of the developed models in productionsystems by using all available data sources, machine learning and other statistical tools and methods. It will also involve presenting results to stakeholders and executives along withutilizing the results to help developing the division strategy.This role requires a high-level of ownership over the end-to-end process, the ability to think outside of the box, willingness to disrupt the current processes to create a new one, the abilityto design sustainable solutions and influence stakeholders.
This role is in Seoul, Korea.
Key responsibilities
 Work with a team of high-performing analytics, data science professionals, and crossfunctional teams to identify business opportunities, optimize service performance. Analyze large-scale structured and unstructured data; develop deep-dive analyses and machine learning models for demand forecasting, robotics  automation. Design and develop core business metrics, create insightful automated dashboards and data visualization to track them and extract useful business insights. Extract data insights and develop effective tools and dashboards to present insights to leadership and drive decision making. Define, prioritize, and track progress of key milestones towards achieving your vision and strategic goals. Apply machine learningoperations researchanalytical techniques to address business needs, improve logistics processes, help cut operation cost, and optimize customer experiences. Define problems, develop customized algorithmsmodels, and perform experimentation to provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Essential qualifications
 Bachelors degree in a quantitative field - Computer Science, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, Supply chain, Operations research, or related discipline. extensive experience in application of machine learningOR techniques to solve practical business problems. Database experience with advanced SQL or SQL-like skills; experience researching and manipulating complex and large data sets. Experience with data visualization tools. Programming experience in Python preferred RSQLSpark to manipulate data, develop algorithmsmodels, and draw insights from large data sets. Knowledge of fulfillment center operations, logistics or supply chain management in the ecommerce industry. Ability to learn new techniques and meet deadlines in a fast-moving environment. Self-starter, outstanding team player with a customer mindset who takes initiative to communicate effectively to a variety of groups.
Preferred qualifications
 Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative discipline. Experience with manipulating massive-scale clickstream data and text mining. Experience formulating linear, convex, and nonlinear optimization problems. Experience in Bayesian inference, reinforcement learning, linear relaxation, and Monte Carlo simulation. Machine learning with a focus on forecasting, Operations research. Knowledge and experience with distributed data computing tools, such as Hive, Spark. Knowledge and experience with Java, C, C. Working knowledge of Unix and Unix-like systems and git.

Job Title: Director of Data Science & Business Intelligence

As Director of Data Science  Business Intelligence you will be empowered to build an enterprise Data Science and BI capability. This role will be critical in scaling our BI infrastructure and unlocking the power of data science in creating stickier experiences to our customers. Your knowledge of statistics, BI infrastructure, and analytics methods combined with your strong management and communication skills will determine how we evolve key areas of our business. In this role you will be a player-coach, fully remote and report to senior leaders in the Analytics and Finance Organization.

Minimum of 3 years managerial experience  Experience with analytics software tools or languages R, Python, etc. and machine learning techniques is a must Working knowledge of visualization platforms and customization Power BI, Tableau etc is a must Must be a highly analytical individual with a strong grasp of modern statistical methods Experience with full lifecycle data science projects is a must Experience with medical data is an added advantage Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Excellent oral and written communication skills

 Join a market leader within the Insurance space Attractive Salary  benefits Unlimited leave days Fantastic work culture Great work-life balance

Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. A few years ago, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed a degree, it was simply too expensive, too complex, too risky and ultimately too inefficient. Thats why only 16 of projects were ever done on budget and 78 failed.
Were changing that. Were flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or do boot camps to learn how to make your app. Builder.ais platform lets you order the perfect software app for whatever problem youre trying to solve. Our AI powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life  ANYONEs world-class ideas.
Building software needs to be like ordering pizza  pick what you want, get recommendations for the features you need and simply wait till its cooked and ready for you.
Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build, run  scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi.
Life at Builder
Its a place where everything moves at lightning pace and most definitely not for the faint hearted. We celebrate diversity, push everyone to do more with less and yet provide a culture that allows everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust  Transparency and were always looking for team players, with a point of view, a sense of humility and a lets-get-stuff-done attitude.
Our scale up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together to savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models. WhatWouldYouBuild
Why We Need This Role
We have created and deployed the Builder Knowledge Graph BKG that serves as a repository of all information on the software domain. Our BKG powers many important AI applications around estimating costs and timelines of software, giving recommendations to customers during software configuration and automating steps in the software assembly and execution. However, we have only scratched the surface of what is possible in this space.
We would like an experienced hand to come in and lead our future efforts to test the art of what is possible in using AI to drive the automated specification, assembly, management and the execution of software projects.
What youll be working on
 Exploit the knowledge in BKG at finding innovative applications of AI during end to end automated software management Advance our state of the art in using representation learning to create embeddings that power various machine learning applications Explore ideas around incorporating context to build personalised recommendation algorithms for targeted customer suggestions Exploring the use of reinforcement learning or similar continuous learning principles to evolve the BKG Take ideas from concept possibly in academic literature to production 
Requirements
 6 Years experience 2 years leading a team of at least 2-3 people PhD in a scientific discipline with significant programming foundations such as Computer Science, Engineering, Physics among others Proficient in programming in at least one high level programming language. Python experience preferable At least 2 years of production experience in conceptualising, developing and productionising AI systems Experience in building personalised recommender systems Core understanding of representation learning Core understanding of deep learning principles applied to structured and unstructured data Experience in working within cross functional teams Understanding product priorities and goals and aligning research, development and execution initiatives to such goals Generating and testing hypotheses for future product features Some background in knowledge graphs, optimisation and reinforcement learning would be very beneficial 
Benefits
 Performance-based bonuses paid on a quarter-by-quarter basis Stock options in a 100 million funded Series C scale-up company Private medical  dental insurance provided by AXA Generous pension contributions Perkbox benefits are currently under review so hoping to offer a lot more soon!

We are advancing AI to power the future of medicine.

At Unlearn, our purpose is to advance artificial intelligence AI to eliminate trial and error in medicine. We are developing generative machine learning methods to predict individual health outcomes and accelerate clinical innovation. Today, we are reimagining the randomized control trial RCT for the 21st century through AI-powered clinical trials or TwinRCT. A TwinRCT allows more trial patients to receive the experimental treatment, reaches full enrollment faster and put patients first. Our innovative work in AI today will reinvent how AI is applied in medicine tomorrow  and we have a top secret plan for how to get there. We wont be able to achieve this mission just by applying technologies created by others; the future must be invented.

Unlearn is a technology company, not a biotech company. We use computers, not pipettes. We make and use software, we dont discover or make drugs. We believe that AI will define the future of medicine, and we arent deterred by naysayers or skeptics. 

We come from a variety of backgrounds ranging from machine learning to marketingbut regardless of where we come from, Unlearners share some common traits

 Unlearners are ambitious; we arent intimidated by big, challenging goals. 
 Unlearners are disciplined experimenters; we break down our big goals into smaller chunks and meet as often as necessary to track our velocity and iterate quickly. 
 Unlearners are gritty; we never give up, setbacks just make us try harder.
 Unlearners are receptive to new ideas; in fact, we hate being stuck with the status quo. 
 Unlearners are storytellers; sharing information with each other and with the world is super important, too important to be boring.  And, last but not least,
 Unlearners are team-oriented; we put the mission first, the company second, the team third, and individuals last.

Founded in 2017 by a team of world-class machine learning scientists, we have raised venture capital from top tier investors such as Insight Partners, Radical Ventures, 8VC, DCVC, and DCVC Bio. We completed our 50 million Series B in April 2022. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA and have an additional office in Boston, MA.

If our purpose and culture resonate with you, we invite you to apply. 


About the role

High-quality data is essential to our success at Unlearn. Internally, we use data products to encapsulate data, domain knowledge, and documentation needed to make excellent AI models. These data products are owned by a group made up of excellent data scientists, clinical scientists, and software engineers. This role will be leading this group as it continues to develop and grow impactful data products that influence modeling and decision-making throughout the company
Responsibilities

Leading the group in its goal to develop innovative data products, data tools, and operationalize them.
Being accountable to company leadership for quarterly and yearly goals on the internal delivery of data products that are used in our ML pipeline.
Working across groups and organizations at Unlearn to achieve strategic objectives.
People management for the group, including hiring and performance management.
Growing technical leadership within the team and contributing technical guidance where useful.

Requirements

7 years of experience
Experience leading teams and working cross-functionally on strategic objectives.
Experience working with clinical datasets.
Demonstrated technical leadership in data science or data analytics.
Experience hiring and managing technical personnel.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Preferred Requirements
Demonstrated experience in collaborative software development.
Experience with clinical datasets in applied machine learning applications.
Experience working in multidisciplinary teams that include scientists, engineers, and product management.

About the role
We are looking for a talented Director level Data Science leader to join the Data team to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solution to help organisations prevent financial crime! 
The role reports to the Chief Data Officer and as such is a member of the senior technology team. As Director of DS, you will be responsible for;

Building, scaling and leading a world class data science team currently 10 people
Working closely with the Director Engineering and Director Product to give leadership to the Data Tribe.
In collaboration with the CDO, create and drive the Data Science Strategy and investment plan
Making ComplyAdvantage a great environment for Data Scientists to operate in. Building clear career progression frameworks; ensuring appropriate tooling and technology is in place.
Delivering models to production and ensuring their is a metrics-oriented culture around measuring and continuously improving model performance.
Acting as a member of the senior data leadership team, helping drive the data strategy for ComplyAdvantage as a company

Regarding this specific role


You would be one of three key leaders in our Data tribe. ComplyAdvantage runs on data; constantly changing data about risk and financial crime drives the applications that our customers buy and use



We ingest data from a very large number of sources, in both structured and unstructured forms 


We then enrich and extract meaning from the data, through the application of various machine learning and natural language processing, to understand the entities - such as people, places and companies - the data pertains to and the connections between them 


We surface the knowledge that we derive from the data, in different forms for the different types of risk our customers are interested in - sanctions, anti-money laundering, criminal risk, fraud, etc. - to the apps developed by our other tribes


You and the Data Scientists in the tribe will be responsible for developing  maintaining the algorithms that are key to the operation of our data supply chain. 

About us
ComplyAdvantage is the financial industrys leading source of AI-driven financial crime risk data and detection technology. Our mission is to neutralise the risk of money laundering, terrorist financing, corruption, and other financial crime.More than 1000 companies rely on us to understand the risk of who theyre doing business with through the worlds only global, real-time database of people and companies. Our solutions identify thousands of risk events daily from millions of structured and unstructured data points.We have four global hubs in New York, London, Singapore, and Cluj-Napoca and are backed by Goldman Sachs, Ontario Teachers, Index Ventures, and Balderton Capital.Since 2014, we have raised over 100 million in funding, and in 2022 alone grew by over 40 to over 500 people globally. Over the next 12 months, as our revenue increases, we plan to increase to 600.No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!
The ideal candidate

Proven experience in leading teams of Data Scientists to create customer value from applying ML techniques 
Experience developing products involving Knowledge Graphs; Natural Language Processing; Computational Linguistics; Entity Extraction and Resolution  Search and other ML approaches.
Whilst this is not a hands on role, your knowledge of current tools and techniques needs to be sufficiently deep to mentor  guide Data Scientists from a technical point of view.
Experience taking one to many ML centric products from conception, into market production and sustained for numerous years.

What we are offering you

Competitive Salary
Equity as we want you to have a part of what we are building
Unlimited Time Off Policy- A work life balance and focus on our wellbeing are critical to keep us performing at our best.
Hybrid working- We want you to strike a balance and be where you do your best work.  You will work with your manager to agree what is best for you and your team.
Opportunity to work on innovative projects with smart like-minded people, who are keen to share their knowledge and continuously improve
You will also get an annual budget of 215 to kit out your home office
Annual learning budget to drive your performance and career development
Enhanced parental leave and childcare benefits
Life Insurance to protect your loved ones
Medical insurance through Bupa with pre-existing conditions covered
Pension contribution through The Peoples Pension

The role is based at our office in central London. We operate a flexible, hybrid working scheme and dont expect our employees to be at the office every working day unless they want to be. Some onsite attendance is required, however, and this is expected to be more frequent for senior managers such as this role.

At ComplyAdvantage diversity fuels our rocket ship and our commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity and experience drives us forward every day. We encourage everyone to apply and aspire to consider every application fairly.

The company  vision.
Everyones got the message machine learning is changing everything. And for Fortune 500 brands in every vertical, its actually true  ML predictions are solving billion-dollar, migraine problems. But for smaller brands, the talent and investment needed to build an ML platform are simply out of reach.  

Black Crow is changing that--fast. Founded by a team that has spent the last decade in machine learning, our mission is to help DTC brands turbocharge their growth by delivering bespoke, Fortune 500-grade ML predictions.  It works out of the box, delivered as a service, and costs less than one data scientist. Integration one click. 

12 months ago, we had one DTC brand using our predictions.  Now we have over 150  including Solo Stove, SAKARA, Native, Keurig, and Bearaby. There are 50,000 more who havent heard of us yet. 

Black Crow AI recently concluded a 25 million Series A led by top investors in the DTC and B2B SaaS sectors, and is well funded for multiple years

The team  culture. 
This is the 3rd company Black Crows founders have started together. Both previous companies scaled to 100MM and were voted Best Places to Work in NYC many times.

The founders are building Black Crow to be commercially successful, high growth, and valuable. But thats insufficient as an end--were also building a company that we actually want to work at! That means we are human first--we dont expect anyone to transform themselves to show up at work. It means working together is a positive force in our lives, not something we tolerate for the paycheck. And it means we see diversity as a strength.


Where you come in

Black Crow AI is seeking an innovative leader for our top notch data team. Were looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit, who isnt afraid to get their hands dirty while scaling this rapidly growing business. In addition to mentoring and guiding day-to-day data science and analytics, youll be a thought leader  hands-on builder who helps scale innovation across all data and machine learning applications at the company. Youll leverage your expertise to inform company strategy at the executive level and partner with product managers and engineers to identify new areas of innovation across our product suite and the platform tooling and architecture required to support them.
What youll do

As a member of the executive team, set the long-term strategy for data at Black Crow AI. Youll stay on top of the latest in the field  determine where we should take risks and place bets on new ideas.
Coach, mentor, and grow our team of stellar data scientists and product data analysts.
Set the vision for and partner with engineering teams to develop our data platform and architecture, from data modeling and business intelligence to real-time machine learning deployment and monitoring.
Be an integral part of product development, applying best practices in experimentation and other quantitative methods to shape product roadmaps.
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources.
Research and develop algorithms and predictive models to solve critical business problems.
Manage work prioritization by asking the right questions
Communicate brilliantly and develop strong relationships at all levels, internally and externally

Youre a leader

Insatiable curiosity and love of learning. Ability to go deep and quickly learn new domains

Love your job.
We love our work and our team. Our machine learning helps flick the lights on for companies so they see their customers more clearly and can uncover the true potential of their tools and teams. In turn, we strive to do the same for our people. Were here to shine light on each other and unlock known and sometimes unexpected potential. 

Our vibrant team accomplishes buckets of awesome every day. We also partake in our fair share of daily laughter. Come build the company youve always wanted to work for - with inspiring products and a community of passionate people.

A Big Plus If You Have

DBT, airflow, and Databricks experience  business intelligence and data science enterprise teams in the past

We are a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial, and innovation-driven organization seeking collaborative, passionate, and dedicated people to join our team.
Flagship Pioneering conceives, creates, resources, and develops first-in-category bioplatform companies to transform human health and sustainability. Since its launch in 2000, the firm has, through its Flagship Labs unit, applied its unique hypothesis-driven innovation process to originate and foster more than 100 scientific ventures, resulting in more than 200 billion in aggregate value. To date, Flagship has deployed over 2.5 billion in capital toward the founding and growth of its pioneering companies alongside more than 19 billion of follow-on investments from other institutions. The current Flagship ecosystem comprises 42 transformative companies, including Axcella Health Nasdaq AXLA, Codiak BioSciences Nasdaq CDAK Denali Therapeutics Nasdaq DNLI, Evelo Biosciences Nasdaq EVLO, Foghorn Therapeutics Nasdaq FHTX, Indigo Ag, Kaleido Biosciences Nasdaq KLDO, Moderna Nasdaq MRNA, Omega Therapeutics Nasdaq OMGA, Rubius Therapeutics Nasdaq RUBY, Sana Biotechnology Nasdaq SANA, Seres Therapeutics Nasdaq MCRB, and Sigilon Therapeutics Nasdaq SGTX.
Position Summary
The Clinical Data Science Manager will execute the data management activities for Harbinger Oncologys clinical studies and other clinical efforts. This position is responsible for ensuring the accurate, complete, and timely collection, management, and delivery of assaygenomic and clinical data for analysis, reporting, and presentation.
Responsibilities

Work closely with the study team and strategic partners to ensure that clinical data captured is complete, consistent, and accurate. 
Perform study startup activities such as study protocol review, Clinical Data Management Plan CDMP development, and EDC set-up.
Manage study conduct activities including facilitation of study team data review, documentation of data handling decisions, issuance of data queries and resolution of data discrepancies.
Utilize programming skills and appropriate tools to provide information as required by study team members.
Provide data visualizations for clinical trial metrics.
Lead data locking efforts, ensuring that study team members have executed according to the CDMP toward the goal of achieving analysis-ready datasets.
Ensure that data integrity is maintained throughout the data lifecycle for sources including clinical data, and bio-specimen data. 
Ensure that documentation is maintained in a state of constant audit-readiness and filed in the Trial Master File.
Develop dashboards for monitoring clinical trial enrollment and other metrics
Work with the digital team to assure pipelines for clinical data ingestion is seamless with high fidelity
Effectively communicate findings to stakeholders

Qualifications

Bachelors degree required; advanced degree preferred. Additional coursework in programming, analytics, or related fields strongly desired.
5 years of industry experience required, with a strong track record of EDC system implementation and collaboration with study teams to ensure data quality.
Knowledge of clinical trials and medical device andor drug development processes. Experience working on study start up, database locks, analysis timepoints and study closeout. 
Experience working on studies under the purview of the FDA and MHRA is a plus. 
Familiarity with various data visualization, analytics, and reporting tools.
Scientific programming, database, and dashboards development experience; Ability to work hands on with data using spreadsheet software required. 
2 years experience programming in Python and SQL preferred, but will accept R or SAS as well.
Strong experience with multiple EDC systems Medrio, RedCapCloud, or similar
Experience implementing EDC systems
Experience in CRO communications, oversight, and management by working effectively both in a core team and functional team settings
Knowledge of GCP, ICH Guidelines, HIPPA, GDPR and use of good clinical data management practices
Molecular diagnostics industry experience preferred.
